info.title: Steps to Convert Word Document to DocBook

emphasis.emphasis: Steps to convert a word document into a DocBook

section.para: General DocBook information can be found here: http://docbook.org/
After you have created a word document using a “stylized’ MS Word Template, use these simple steps to convert that DOCX file into an XML file:
Use an XML conversion tool, such as the free one located at URL: www.xmlmind.com/w2x/docx_to_docbook.html
NOTE: This will allow you to convert up to 3 times in any 24-hour period
Click Browse and navigate to your desired DOCX file that you wish to convert
Choose the selected output format (such as DocBook v5.0 Article), and click convert
NOTE: If you want to integrate with ISAACS KOMET DocBook project later, you MUST convert it to a DocBook v5.0 format.
This will download a zip file:

Unzip the file; inside the newly unzipped file will be a directory. You will see an XML format version of your document inside. This will allow you to edit the XML file, and convert it to PDF, HTML, etc. for use in other documents.

listitem.para: When you select the Text mode to view the actual XML, if all of the XML appears on one line OR if you receive a message stating, "this document contains long lines which may affect performance when opened in the text editor", then click the Format and Indent button. Then, it should display the formatted XML.
If there were any pictures in your document, they will be in another directory, inside the first.

emphasis.emphasis: Working inside an IDE, within the context of the larger document:

listitem.para: You need an integrated development environment installed, such as Eclipse.
Install plugin from OxygenXML (provides tools to directly edit these types of documents)
Install plugin from GitHub (source code control repository, which is needed to view all current KOMET book materials)
Check for or Install plugin for Maven (configuration management and build environment; generates PDFs, HTMLs, and archived versions from XML files)
